intro: Stoebe kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Africa. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Stoebe kilimandscharica plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to the biodiversity of its native range.
